page.title: 02FARMING - ANIMALS
page.content: Most animal farmers go in for pig rearing but there are plenty of beef cattle and one farmer specialises in goats. The farms are quite large and a typical one is Mr.Crossley's which is 400 acres in 26 fields. The pigs are fed on pig cobs which are bought from Thomsons of Murton.The cattle are fed on Mr. Crossley's own barley and also hay. There are hardly any sheep at all to be found in this area, but there are thousands on the North York Moors and the Yorkshire Wolds which are about 20 miles away. The area between here and Malton is well known for training race horses.Mr.Brittain trains 50 horses at Warthill in this block.
